issue.description: Shouldn't there be a definition of the term state so that it can be referenced in the module?

comment.description: Have added definition in addition to brief introduction for both schemas.

issue.description: There are two entities 'sharing' the same shortname at the moment. This occured during the shortname generation where two express files, one for each schema, were uploaded. shortname name="STT0" entity="state_assessment" shortname name="STT0" entity="state_type_role"

comment.description: Re-registered both express files as one express file and easily obtained unique names.

issue.description: I have had real difficulty with the thought that one might predict a state_observed.

comment.description: this is necessary in Part 56, given the use of the state_predicted subtype in the state_observed modules. In distinguishing type from 'individual' and 'planned' from 'realized' state behaves like activity, rather than product.

issue.description: duplication of first paragraph 4th and 5th paras: change 'criterium' to 'criteria'
Include a state history i.e. state_observed (currently out of scope). Consider including scopes from state_observed and state_definition modules.
Add the classification of states. Move state history to in-scope

Strengthen definitional nature. Suggest first section is changed to read: A state type captures some unique aspect or aspects that identify and characterise a potential observed state to which reference needs to be made. A state type defines a state that an individual item may be observed or predicted to possess for a period of time. Different individuals may by in the state defined by a state type for different time periods, some of which may overlap. When the characteristics defined by the state type are present the item is said to be in that state.
Third para, second and third sentence: change to read 'A state type may be related to another state type by a cause and effect relationship, where one state type causes or results from another. State types may also be related as a sequence, through which one state type may transition into another state type. The nature of the relationship between two state types is defined by the description attribute on the state_type_relationship entity.'
Final sentence to read: Data recording the predicted or observed existance of an individual in a state are the subject of the state_observed_schema.
4.4.1 Entity Definition: change final word 'state' to 'state type'. Hence: Applied state type assignment allows a subject to have or to be in a state type.

Suggest reword first sentence to read : An observed state represents the existence of an individual item, for a period of time, when it is observed, or predicted to possess recognisable characteristics that may not be present at a different time. The characteristics that describe an observed state may be recorded in the description attribute of the observed_state entity, or by reference to relevant state_types using the state_assertion or state_assessment entities.
Second para, from second sentence: change to read: This reflects the diagnosis process where something may be observed or predicted to be in an abnormal state before the precise cause, and hence state type, is known. A general state type may be asserted initially. As investigations proceed other, more precise, state types can be associated as assessed states. Other state types can be asserted as not applying.
5.3.1 add to current definition: ....It identifies the item which is in an observed state.
5.4.4 what does state_assesment mean? Please provided further explanation
There is no punctuation on the list items for inscope and outscope. Should have a semicolon at the end of each line and a period for the last item.

Style issues:
Cover page is missing the CD copyright statement from the Supplementary Directives. There are words missing on the comments to readers (should say " ready for this ballot cycle" as opposed to "for"
Foreword mentions an optional Annex E - where is it? There only appears to be A-D.
Introduction
The Major subdivision text appears twice - in two different formats... and get replace the text strings following the '$' with what is supposed to be there.
The statement that begins with 'For example, a state might be...' needs to be put in the example format:

'This reflects the diagnosis process where something is known to be in an abnormal state but the precise reason is not known (and therefore state type) is not known.'
should be changed to
'This reflects the diagnosis process where something is known to be in an abnormal state but the precise reason (and therefore state type) is not known'

comment.description: Wording is now consistent with proposal.

issue.description: 5.4.1 the definition for the attribute 'item_set' ends in a preposition.
Attribute definitions begin with 'This attribute describes...' Remove 'This attribute describes'.
the entity name for short name STTCYN is missing from the table.
WG numbers missing.
the ballot package number is missing from the html

comment.description: Fixed. Now appears at top of each page.

issue.description:
Boiler plate is missing from cover:
'Recipients of this draft are invited to to submit, with their comments, notification of any relevant patent rights of which they are aware and to provide supporting documentation.'
normative or informative is not in TOC heading
No index is present.

When the package received (as a zip file) - need to have an N_Number on the document. Suggest putting package number in the header of the module_index.htm. or rename module_index.htm as module_index_WGXXYYY.htm. XX is the WG number, YYYY is the N-Number.

comment.description: Added to ballot package N-number to name of zip file. Created additional copy of index.htm named (ballot_number).htm

issue.description: Change module_index to something else througout, since this is not a module.

4) XML/HTML General - When you are in the IR, the HTML header has dates and versions on it - kill this info. Generic document number and ISO year and some high level info is ok, but the material in parenthesis is not needed when we go out
5) XML/HTML - Cover sheet Keywords should include, in general, STEP, ISO 10303. ISO puts these in their database (or ISO used to anyway for standards searches).
3) XML/HTML for parts - Suggest that ballot package file module_index.htm have the ISO number in the header of the HTML and in the main screen.... ISO 10303 in general...maybe others in the future.

comment.description: HTML now jumps to cover page, since there is only one document in this (or any IR) ballot.

issue.description: 6) XML/HTML? - The Keywords need to be separated by commas.
9) XML/HTML - The forward does not have the correct words for an IS document. See SDs para 4.1.4.1.1 and subsequent section. Need to delete and change a few items.
10) XML/HTML - There should be no bolding for the major subdivisions of the document or the schema names. This is not a module.

11) XML/HTML? - Figure 1 should be Figure 1, not Figure 1.1 in the text. 12) Introduction - Figure 1 name - this is too long, Shorten -see comments from ISO 10303-57 review and following item in SDs (#13 below)
13) Introduction - You are missing a paragraph related to relationship between schema - See SD 4.1.5.1.1 for correct wording. Please fix.

comment.description: Fixed or N/A for this IR. Could be relevant for a more complicated one.

issue.description: 15) General comment - add OPTIONAL description on a lot of entities.

16) Table D.1 - this should not be a table of Figures. The Table name is even wrong for what it contains. You need to have a sentence that references the figures correctly, or do like we have done in other annex with the correct callouts.

17) Technical and XML/HTML? Table C.1 - do not add another line for the combined express. Put the express callout in the last column where you have 'Identifier'. It will be the same callout for both of the remaining lines.
18) Fundamental question - should 'state_type' be 'state'. Should this be a subtype of another IR item - not suggesting this, but you need to think about it.
19) Clause 4 - Should this schema be called 'state_type' or 'state_definition'. This is a fundamental concept that we need to get correct for a broader user base.
Also - you refer to this document as a ISO/TS - it is not! This is an IR that is going to be an International Standard, not a Technical Specification.
ISO require that we submit abstracts for the modules.

comment.description: Added abstract capability. Scope is used if none provided in document.

issue.description: Clause titles: h2 for level 1, h3 for level 2, etc. Why? It does not say anything about this in the HTML guidelines Make them all h2 Title h1
Add meta elements as specified in the HTML Guidelines.

Move the a copyright notice to a separate page after the Cover page. Do you mean the copyright on the contents page? Add a copyright link in the Table of contents block after the Table f contents entry

comment.description: The Resource HTML is now the same as the Module HTML. The copyright has an entry in the table of contents block. The copyright notice appears at the end of the table of contents page.

issue.description: Indent each level with five nbsp entities. Same applies to index at top of each page. Change the TOC page and leave the TOC block as is.

comment.description: Fixed to look the same as modules.

issue.description: Should not be blank lines between lines of scope. Use two level list

Superscripts overlap dashes. Use a em dash followed by the superscripted number. Use em dashes to connect components of a standard title (between 'Industrial automation systems and integration" and "Product data representation and exchange'). Will be raised as a Ballot comment '

comment.description: This was raised as an issue against the modules HTML and a disposition granted by WG3 convener.

comment.description: NA for this document but may come up later
This was raised against the modules by the WG12 and WG3 conveners and a disposition granted.

issue.description: HTML page title of the resource docs is: CD 56 :- state It should be ISO/CD-TS 10303-56:- State
Excessive white space at bottom and in a few cases top of diagrams.

5.3.5 state_observed_relationship wording is incorrect
'A state_observed_relationship relates two instances of the entity state_observed_relationship ... '
should read
'A state_observed_relationship relates two instances of the entity state_observed ... '
Express identifiers in express schema documentation need hyperlinks when they are not locally defined.

comment.description: Express identifiers added to resource.xml where applicable.

issue.description: Scope needs special header.

description.p: Ballot comment

Terms such as 'State' are engrained in various domains, often with domain-specific meaning. To facilitate reuse across domains, these terms and their definitions should be as generic as possible. Domain-specific interpretation is achieved in individual AM's. Rationale: The use of the term 'condition' which itself can take on the meaning of 'state', makes this a circular definition. Also, the implicit inclusion of time, 'does or could exist' (what about 'did exist'). Is viewed as an unnecessary constraint for this definition.
Replace definition: 'The condition in which something does or could exist' With the definition 'Mode of being'

comment.description: Updated definition to 'A state_type is a mode of being.'

description.p: ISO 10303-41 shall be listed here because it is referred to in this document.
Add 10303-41 to the list.
Ballot comment
state_type_of_item may be missing.
The sentence may be 'A state_type_of_item identifies the item(s) having a state type.'

comment.description: This no longer applies since the select 'state_type_of_item' has been removed.

description.p: Ballot comment

The schema uses extensible selects which are not used elsewhere in the integrated resources. These are used in assignment-entities which so far have been modelled as management resources in ISO 10303-41.
Apply the same style to assignment-entities as is currently in the integrated resources.

comment.description: Applied the same style to assignment-entities as is currently in the integrated resources.

description.p: Ballot comment
The assignment-entities in the two schemas use attributes 'item_set'. This does not conform to the style in ISO 10303.
Rename the attributes 'item_set' to 'items'. If the previous comment is followed, this comment will be obsolete as the items-attribute would then be removed.

comment.description: The previous comment SC4N1543_NO_1 has been followed, this comment has become obsolete.

description.p: Ballot comment
In many places in the schemas the attibute types are STRING. This does not conform to the style in ISO 10303.
Replace STRING-types by types from the support_resource_schema (ISO 10303-41), such as label and text.

comment.description: Replaced STRING-types by types from the support_resource_schema using label and text.

issue.description:
Ballot comment
The definitions of the concepts in clauses 4 and 5 are rather brief and may lead to ambiguous interpretations.
Add examples to the definitions of the new concepts.

description.p: Clause 4 examples added.
EXAMPLE 1 An inspection process measures the length of a crack, and declares the part to be 'defective'. A second process replaces parts that are 'defective'.

EXAMPLE 2 A quality control process defines the allowable variance between an independent laboratory's test result of a product and the product's specification limit, and judges the quality of the product to be out of specification or 'off-spec'. A second process rejects products that are 'off-spec'.
Clause 5 examples added.
EXAMPLE 1 Main Engine Fuel Pump No. 1 is in the phase of 'injection'.
EXAMPLE 2 A hydrogen atom can be 'excited' or 'decayed'.
EXAMPLE 3 A particular system of atoms will be at 'thermal equilibrium' later but not now, or at a certain temperature.
EXAMPLE 4 After my portable computer displayed a 'low-battery' warning, I immediately attached its power supply.
Ballot comment
There are several spelling errors in the text (managment, pertatining).
Apply a spell checker.
Ballot comment
The style of definitions does not conform to ISO 10303, both in style and contents. Example: ascribed_state: This attribute identifies the ascribed state observed.
Change definitions to be compliant with the Suplementary Directives. Provide definitions that do more than just repeat the name of the concept.

comment.description: Changed definitions to be compliant with the Suplementary Directives.

description.p: Ballot comment
The link behind ISO TC184/SC4/WG12 N1821 does not work.
Repair the link.

comment.description: To be completed during creation of HTML.

I have this problem on Netscape but no other browser. I am not sure of the root cause, but I changed the application of exp to notepad and Netscape brings up notepad, Opera just opens in the application, and Netscape offers to save, and if you say open it says access to the device is denied.
Reject. The URL is correct. This appears to be an issue of browser or browser settings.

Title in of figure 1 should not have a period after 'Figure 1'

Error in schema_diagram link to external schema

Table of Contents subclause indenture is less than 5 spaces required by HTML guidelines.
hrefs back to ballot package index are not valid per Homesite. (However they work correctly in four browsers.)

comment.description: As per Dreamweaver, this is valid. Browser (MSIE6.0) check done.

issue.description: Table of contents Figures should precede tables
HTML not valid because of attributes <h2 xmlns:msxsl="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:xslt" xmlns:exslt="http://exslt.org/common" > added by microsoft?
Numbering of (sub)clauses and definitions is incorrect in main.htm. NaN shows up Express clause numbers.
PRE tags use for functions are invalid html
NOTE and EXAMPLE in schema descriptions is generating improperly closed and or nested P tags,

Clause 4.3
Summary/Abstract/Keywords: Inconsistent semantics due to non-unique name
Problem Description: Instances of state_type, state_type_relationship and state_type_role entities should have a unique name within a dataset. Otherwise two or more instances with the same name but different description/definition could possibly exist, which would lead to inconsistent or ambiguous semantics w.r.t. the instanciated state types.
Related Issues: NL-3
Proposed change : Modify the ENTITY definitions with a UNIQUE constraint as follows: UNIQUE ur1: name;

comment.description: No such restrictions are found on entity names in other Integrated Generic Resources.
The rejections are all agreed, as a ballot comments resolution "meeting" by email was completed after Seattle SC4.

issue.description:
Clause 4.3.3
Summary/Abstract/Keywords: Inconsistent specification of attributes of state_type_relationship
Problem Description: The textual definitions for the relating_state_type and related_state_type suggest single state_type instances being referenced while the EXPRESS definition specifies SET [1:?] OF state_type. This is inconsistent and should be corrected: specify consistently either "one state_type instance" or "one or more state_type instances".
Correct as indicated.

comment.description: Changed descriptions to be consistent with EXPRESS definition.

Confirmed the descriptions as follows:
relating_state_type: one of the sets of instances of state_type_relationship that is a part of the relationship.
related_state_type: the other set of instances of state_type_relationship that is a part of the relationship.
Other resource parts do not have UNIQUE constraints on entity names.
The rejections are all agreed, as a ballot comments resolution "meeting" by email was completed after Seattle SC4.

issue.description:
NL4 Clause 3.3
Summary/Abstract/Keywords: Editorial error in URL definition
Problem Description: "URL universal resource locator" definition is wrong, should read "URL uniform resource locator"
Correct as indicated.

comment.description: Confirmed the abbreviation for URL as "uniform resource locator".

issue.description:
Clause 4.3.1
Summary/Abstract/Keywords: Editorial error in clause 4.3.1 NOTE 2
Problem Description: Typo in NOTE 2: "managment" should read "management"
Correct as indicated.

Clause 5.3.3
Summary/Abstract/Keywords: Editorial error in clause 5.3.3 NOTE 3
Problem Description: Typo in NOTE 3: "may be different states" should read "may be in different states"
Correct as indicated.

comment.description: Confirmed that the note has been updated and corrected.

issue.description: 4.3.3 1st sentence ed The following statement is not adequate because this relationship is between two SETs of state_type. A state_type_relationship is a relationship that relates two instances of the entity state_type and provides an identification and description of their relationship. It is recommended to modify as follows. A state_type_relationship is a relationship that relates instances of two kinds of the entity state_type and provides an identification and description of their relationship.

comment.description: There is not a guarantee in all usages that the related state_types will be of different kinds. For example the state_type of a simulation could be the same for two sequentially related instances, thus indicating transients have died out.

Propose the following modifications:
"A state_type_relationship is a relationship that relates instances of two sets of the entity state_type and provides an identification and description of their elationship."

issue.description: 5.3.5 1st sentence ed ditto (similar to JP1) ditto

comment.description:
Updated 5.3.5 dentity definition and attributes to the following:
A state_observed_relationship is a relationship that relates instances of two sets of the entity state_observed and provides an identification and description of their relationship.
relating_state_observed: one of the sets of instances of state_observed_relationship that is a part of the relationship.
related_state_observed: the other set of instances of state_observed_relationship that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

issue.description: USE FROM not allowed in a IR.
Will not be published in 2004.
